content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function to clean the column names:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String) 
    col = lowercase(col) # Converting string to lower case.
    col = strip(col)     # Removing leading and trailing spaces from string.
    col = replace(col, " " => "_") # Replacing all spaces with underscore.
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_") # Replacing all hyphens with underscore.
    return col 
end
```
You can then use the `clean_column` function to clean column names like so:

```julia
println(clean_column("My Column"))  # This will print "my_column"
```
